title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Wednesday 28 September 2016 - BBC News
summary: foxes beat fc porto in champions league .
council asked to oppose grammar schools .
measham grave digger 'best in the uk ' .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: updates on leicestershire local live have now finished for the day - they will start again on thursday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : chance of heavy rain tonight
text: south westerly winds continue to strengthen with outbreaks of rain arriving from the northwest after dark .
occasionally heavy but it 'll mostly clear by dawn .
lows around 14c ( 57f ) .
a bright and breezy day tomorrow with plenty of sunshine just the small chance of isolated showers in the afternoon .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: your comments : police safely stop car on m1
text: you 've been watching and commenting on the video of the police safely stopping a car on the m1 after the driver became unwell .
ian moore says : `` fantastic selfless act by the policeman involved .
glad he was recognised for his bravery in preventing a tragedy from occurring . ''
suzy maria said : `` well done to the officer , things could have been a lot worse if it was n't for his actions . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: new flood defences showcased
text: the environment agency have been showing off their new flood risk schemes in leicester this afternoon .
they say there was lots of interest from locals and consultants from across the country .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man jailed for throwing a puppy from a window
text: a horrible story to end on today a man who threw a two-month-old puppy from a second-floor window after taking cocaine has been jailed for 10 weeks .
leicester magistrates heard wayne keightley , 42 , threw the staffordshire bull terrier puppy out the window of his property on rutland street in melton mowbray causing the dog to fall about 20ft .
he denied the offence at his trial .
some good news though - the dog was not seriously injured .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jail for bribing businessman
text: so how did thompson get the money to bribe harper for work ?
well he charged more to do the work .

thompson , who lives on ross close in melton mowbray , has been sentenced to 18 months in prison while glyn orridge from tamar road in the town was ordered to carry out 100 hours of community service .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: melton boss payed out thousands for royal jobs
text: ron harper was the man in charge of royal household maintenance with a yearly budget of £ 2.3m .
he made sure the melton-based company got work at the palaces in exchange for payment .
he received a total £ 100,000 from thompson and other companies between 2006-2011 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : toomua arriving in leicester
text: richard cockerill says leicester tigers summer signing matt toomua will give the club something they have n't had since the likes of anthony allen and pat howard retired .
the 25-year-old australian international arrives at the club this week .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: men bribed their way in
text: steven thompson is a former director of melton power services ( mps ) and glynn orridge was a sub-contractor .
the men got work at places like buckingham palace and kensington palace by bribing the man in charge of their maintenance .
they both pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit fraud .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: melton men sentenced for fraud
text: two businessman from melton mowbray have been sentenced for being involved in a bribery scam to get work at royal households .
this is a pretty complicated case so i 'll explain it bit-by-bit .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cloudy but warm for the time of year
text: here 's the latest visible satellite
a lot of cloud in the west but brighter skies in the east and for the 28 september , it 's warm .
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: russia blamed for plane crash
text: a dutch-led investigation into the malaysian airlines crash in eastern ukraine has accused russia of supplying the missile that shot down the plane in 2014 .
richard mayne from leicester and ben pocock who was studying at loughborough university were among almost 300 people who died in the plane crash .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman thanks police for preventing a 'potentially fatal ' crash
text: the driver was a 34-year-old woman who has not been named by police .
after it happened in april this year she said : i ca n't find the words to express my gratitude to the two officers involved .
when i was told exactly what had happened i was very emotional .
i dread to think what the outcome may have been or how many people could have been involved in a potentially fatal accident . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dramatic police rescue
text: here 's some pretty incredible video footage of leicestershire police stopping a vehicle on the m1 after the driver went into a diabetic coma with her child in the back
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no sticky fingers near the davis cup trophy
text: not many people were there to see the trophy at first but it 's on display until 17:00 so perhaps the crowds will up .
de montfort hall have been told to make sure there are no thumb prints on it when it 's given back someone take them some gloves .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch kayleigh 's love story in hinckley
text: today 's screenings of # kayleighslovestory take place at hinckley hub , rugby road at 3:30pm , 4:30pm , 5:30pm , 6:30pm & 7:30pm
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: trophy on display now
text: here it is - the davis cup trophy at de montfort hall
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: silence for oakham rugby player
text: a minute 's silence was held by rugby players in rutland last night to remember the oakham rfc player that died on saturday .
oakham rfc said on facebook it was a `` solemn moment of peace '' .
savanaca kokoibulileka collapsed and died during the match against west bridgeford .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tennis trophy comes to leicester
text: the davis cup trophy will be on display at de montfort hall in leicester this afternoon - you can go and take a look .
if like me you do n't know what the davis cup is - it 's an annual international tennis competition
we won it last year .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man killed on a5 identified
text: a 21-year-old man who died after being hit by a lorry on the a5 has been named by police .
damian solecki 's body was found on the northbound carriageway between the village of wibtoft and high cross road on saturday 17 september .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: red sky at night
text: you 've uploaded some cracking photos of the sunset over leicestershire last night - this was captured by christina in measham
you can just about see some sheep in the field i wonder if christina is a `` delighted '' shepard .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: resignation down to ' indiscretion and embarrassment '
text: john williams specialises in the sociology of football at the university of leicester and has been looking into the resignation of england manager sam allardyce .
he says : `` i do n't think anything particularly corrupt was being discussed here .
i think this is more indiscretion and embarrassment rather than any suggestion of corruption . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: couple divided by football
text: i wonder what the atmosphere was like between these two last night ?
jennifer is a leicester city fan and her portuguese partner amancio supports fc porto
i think it 's fair to say she certainly looks happier than he does .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes focus to move back to the premier league
text: you might think claudio ranieri would be like the cat that got the cream after last night 's win but actually he 's saying he does n't want to get too carried away .
he reminded journalists last night that copenhagen ( who are also in leicester 's group ) had just won 4-0 so the foxes are not yet guaranteed a place in the knock-out stages of the competition
he wants the team now to `` clean their mind '' and focus back on the premier league again .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: trains running again
text: problem solved
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: more cloud building over the coming hours however there 'll still be a few bright and sunny spells with highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: forty minute delays to journeys
text: east midlands trains have put up on their website that the 40 minute delays to journeys between between leicester and kettering is expected to continue until 13:45 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: technical issues on the railway line
text: technical issues on the railway line
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rail delays towards market harborough
text: rail delays towards market harborough
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: principals views on creating new grammar schools
text: rawlins academy in quorn used to be a grammar school but it 's now a comprehensive and recently got academy status .
principal callum orr says : `` i do n't quite understand how a selective , divisive system is going to improve people 's opportunities to make their way in life .
what the government should be focusing on is making sure that every school in this country is a fantastic school . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: head teacher wants school to be 'in the best hands ' when he dies
text: an inspirational leicester headteacher has spoken of his continuing battle with terminal cancer .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: tory councillor questions motion on grammar schools
text: the conservative councillor ivan ould questions the point of geoff welsh 's motion .
he says : `` you have to ask how relevant it is to get so worked up about grammar schools when so little is proposed to be invested . ''
this is because theresa may is only looking to spend £ 50m - enough for just two grammar schools according to mr ould .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: councillor trying to persuade council about grammar schools
text: geoff welsh wants the authority to tell the government not to relax restrictions on selective schools .

he says : `` i do n't want anyone writing off at 11 so i want to persuade the county council that they need to support this motion to tell the government clearly that we do n't need grammar schools back in leicestershire . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council asked to oppose new grammar schools
text: there 's been a lot in the national news about grammar schools over the last few weeks because the prime minister wants lift the ban on new ones opening .
well today a lib dem liberal councillor will ask leicestershire county council to fight all attempts to open new grammar schools in our area .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: reporter gets stuck into grave digging
text: looks like bbc radio leicester 's helen mccarthy has been helping out david homer over in measham
bizarre but interesting morning , digging my first grave !
with # ukgravediggeroftheyear @ twitterid
check out the bleeding tombstone of st.marys churchyard # hinckley # folklore
when is his anniversary ? ?
12th april 1727
i 'll put in a reminder for next year in our newsroom diary : )
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: grave digger goes 'above and beyond '
text: david homer has been digging graves for the last nine years - along with his team he helps to dig about 300 graves a year .
the good funeral awards crowned him as the uk 's best saying he often goes above and beyond what others in the profession offer .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: measham man is uk 's top grave digger
text: i 'm not sure `` grave digger of the year '' is a title i 'd like it sounds a bit morbid .
but this man from measham has won the award and says it 's `` fantastic '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : traffic lights not working
text: there 's a traffic light failure on gravel street in both directions in leicester at the abbey street junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: men arrested for leicester assault
text: police have arrested five people in connection with an assault on belgrave road over the weekend .
it all kicked off in the car park of the b & m store .
three men were injured including a 25-year-old man who 's still in hospital in a `` stable condition '' .
all five people arrested are men aged between 17 and 33 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: king tweets about foxes 'massive win '
text: great night with @ twitterid football in leicester and massive win too # lcfc
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid للامام
10 years ago andy you were playing hartlepool you 've come a long way
has the ref made it out alive ?
get big was to have a quiet word !
love it ! !
so proud .
x
and that you got on the pitch for cl debit
you 've earned this moment you absolute legend !
well done
great game !
to continue working so hard let foxes !
great photo
through patiently waiting for the time to strike .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ranieri jokes about taking england job
text: leicester city manager claudio ranieri jokes he does `` not get on with the bookmakers '' when asked if he is on their list of next england managers .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: east midlands weather forecast
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : delays on m6
text: worth knowing if you 're heading into warwickshire this morning
one lane is closed and there 's queuing traffic on the m6 northbound between j3 and j3a for the m6 toll .
there 's been an accident and recovery work is underway .
congestion is all the way back to j1 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: leicester man jailed for manslaughter of businessman
text: yesterday we heard that a 26-year-old man from leicester had been jailed for 23 years for manslaughter .
you can read the full story of how akhtar javeed was shot and killed here .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: slimani the dragon slayer
text: this was the reaction from leicester man gary lineker who was presenting the tv coverage of the match on bt sport
love the nickname for slimani .
slimani ( the dragon slayer ) gives @ twitterid the lead .
bosh !
allardyce shat on england though
lineker shat !
on us at # oufc may 86 big eared wool ; o (
he should have been suspended after that fault against @ twitterid in # bruges
could create more history 1st team to win the cl and be relegated in same season
my thoughts exactly lmfao i doubt relegation tho but early days
shat on slimani
who said islam was bad ?
shat on bosh !
leicester loving the champions league and the champions league loving leicester
bosh that 's a technical phrase i take it bit like big sam bosh !
who is the co commentator on the spurs game ?
recognise the voice , bugging the hell out of me
clive allen !
the old man said that , should have believed him , knew gary would n't help but thank you matthew !
dragon shatter
so what you going to do if lcfc win the champions league ?
500-1 odds to win the cl
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: slimani scores foxes a winner
text: this was the moment islam slimani headed in leicester 's only goal last night that took them to a 1-0 win over fc porto
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: well what a night that was .
i bet there 's a few sore heads in leicester this morning .
the foxes moved a step closer to winning this at the king power last night
more on this throughout the day on local live as well as the rest of the days news , sport , weather and travel .
as always i 'd love to hear from you - email , facebook or twitter are the ways to get in touch .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
